Package com.atakmap.util

Class ReferenceCount<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.util.ReferenceCount<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The referenced type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SQLiteSingleTileReader.SharedDb
    public class ReferenceCount<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Thread-safe reference counting class with disposal hook on dereference.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      T value  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ReferenceCount​(T value)
      Creates a new instance that claims a reference on the value (initial count is set to 1).
      ReferenceCount​(T value, boolean reference)
      Creates a new instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void dereference()
      Decrements the reference count.
      int getReferenceCount()  
      boolean isReferenced()
      Returns a flag indicating whether or not the value is currently referenced.
      protected void onDereferenced()
      Invoked when the count reaches 0 via invocation of dereference().
      T reference()
      Increments the reference count.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • value

        public final T value

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReferenceCount

        public ReferenceCount​(T value)
        Creates a new instance that claims a reference on the value (initial count is set to 1).
        Parameters:
        value - The value

      • ReferenceCount

        public ReferenceCount​(T value,
                      boolean reference)
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        value - The value
        reference - If true the count is set to 1; if false the count is set to 0

    • Method Detail

      • isReferenced

        public final boolean isReferenced()
        Returns a flag indicating whether or not the value is currently referenced.
        Returns:
        true if the reference count is greater than zero, false otherwise.

      • reference

        public final T reference()
        Increments the reference count.

      • dereference

        public final void dereference()
        Decrements the reference count. If the count reaches 0 onDereferenced() will be invoked.

      • getReferenceCount

        public final int getReferenceCount()

      • onDereferenced

        protected void onDereferenced()
        Invoked when the count reaches 0 via invocation of dereference().

        The default implementation returns immediately.
